chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)
Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim Marie Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence with Huber privileges for employment.
Probation can be terminated by the agent after 18 months.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $365 to Joyce T.
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $640 to Marci H.
- Restitution to be paid no later than 02-12-2016 from attorney trust account.
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Continue treatment for as long as recommended by doctor (this includes methadone and therapy)
- Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with Attorney Michael s Winter.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  

- Court sets Restitution at $365  and $640

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  12  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with Huber privileges for employment; credit for 5  (five) days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2  YEARS  with the following conditions:  Probation can be terminated by the agent after 18 months
-  Continue treatment for as long as recommended by doctor (this includes methadone and therapy)
-  Maintain full-time employment
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $365 to Joyce T.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $640 to Marci H.
-  Restitution to be paid no later than 02-12-2016 from attorney trust account
-  Perform 50 hours of community service
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court adjourns matter for sentencing.  Parties informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State just received the medical records.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties are still waiting on medical records.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties request more time as an offer has not been made and the State is still waiting to receive medical records.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  
Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Parties request date for scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Ronald Dague for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Arraignment is scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No driving AT ALL  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kim Marie Scott
Current: 3485 North 67th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 04-22-2015)
Prior: 3485 North 67th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joyce T. and Marci H. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Kim Marie Scott in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel's Motion to DISMISS counts 1 and 2 was DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/22/15 @ 1:30pm
